place.name: LLANDDEWI ABERGWESYN
place.gazetteerText: LLANDDEWI-ABERGWESSIN, a parish in Builth district, Brecon; at the influx of the river Gwessin to the Irvon, 14 miles W by N of Builth r. station. Post town, Llandovery, under Carmarthen. Acres, 10,511. Real property, £652. Pop., 111. Houses, 20. The property is divided among a few. The surface is mostly mountainous, wild, and waste. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the p. curacy of Llanfihangel-Abergwessin, in the diocese of St. David's The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
